name: Loch Lein Country House

reviews.text: We've just left Loch Lein Country House after a wonderful experience that was too brief. Our family of four stayed at Loch Lein just one night on our trip through Ireland. We arrived later than expected and were warmly greeted by Annette and quickly checked in to our rooms. We were tired from a long journey of driving through the beautiful Irish countryside and needed a quiet, restful night. The hospitality at Loch Lein could not have been better -- not only did they keep the restaurant open for us so that we could have a delicious dinner, Annette offered to get our laundry started and finished it before we turned in for the night. Amazing service with a smile. Beyond the warm hospitality the accommodations were immaculate and beautiful. Our entire family agreed that we would return to Ireland just to have another stay at Loch Lein. Thank you for making our vacation so lovely.
reviews.title: Magical Experience
Excellent!
reviews.text: We were overwhelmed with the generosity and graciousness of our hosts Paul and Anette. They were at the door ever time we walked in asking if we needed anything or there to give us tips on where to go. The room had an amazing view and was very peaceful. The breakfast was also excellent. We were treated like the only people in the place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here overnight on the 15th April. It was the first night they re-opened after winter and we were the only guests. It was cold, windy and rainy but that didn't stop Paul from coming out to our car and collecting our luggage. Both he and Annette were very welcoming and wonderful hosts. Paul helped us with our itinerary for the next day and offered suggestions for places in town for dinner that evening. The next day was sunny and bright and the view from our room the lake was beautiful. The breakfast they put on for the two of us was amazing! Would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Ireland.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the #1 hotel on trip advisor for a reason, everything about our stay was perfect. We stayed solely on the trip advisor reviews, and it paid off. When we pulled up to the hotel, we arrived late after a drive from Waterford through the mountains of Macroom (which was also amazing) and Paul greeted us with open arms. He was genuinely interested in our trip and us. We were in Room 11, which was right over the entrance and was so picture perfect it is hard to describe. It was very large with a large bed, sitting area, and plenty of room for your luggage. The bathroom had a seperate tub and shower, which I loved. The room was spotless and really comfy and homey. Breakfast was also fantastic. You had a cold buffett and then could choose from a menu with eggs, waffles, etc. Everything was perfect. We hit the pubs in town, so cannot comment on dinner, but the dining room was also full, so it must be wonderful like everything else. We explored the Ring of Kerry on our second day and when we came back late again and the young gentlemen who meet us was also interested in our day and always offered tea or coffee upon arrival. Our room had 2 over sized dormer windows that overlooked a beautiful pasture and moutain range. It was so quiet and peaceful, we slept better than we ever have in any hotel ever before! It was awesome!
reviews.title: Incredible Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also had an ironing board and hair dryer, if that is helpful.
reviews.title: Loved every moment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say more than already written about that beautiful place ? We have spent great moments here. We have had a beautiful weather and the view from our comfortable suite was just stunning. The location is more than great...Just ten minutes driving from Killarney Town Center, it's quiet...relaxing, just seat and contemplate the changing of the colors...Paul and Annette are great hosts. The Breakfast is very tasty and we enjoyed it, don't hesitate to test all the cooked ones ! We will return to Loch Lein as soon as we can, for sure.
reviews.title: Unforgettable Moments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I did a 10-day trip to Ireland. We arrived in Dublin and rented a car to drive the country! I did my research and booked two nights at Loch Lein. The reviews on TripAdvisor had been very good, but I wanted to see for myself. After driving all day, we found the house fairly easily. When we drove up, we were immediately greeted! We checked in and were extremely happy with the house itself, our room, and the staff. Everything was very clean and attended to. The room was spacious, clean, and cozy. The bathroom was nice and big with nice soap and lotion. On our first night, we were given a wonderful recommendation on where to go in Killarney. Paul recommended Murphy's, and we had a great time, and ended up staying a lot longer than we had planned! The next day, he helped us chart our course for the Ring of Kerry. He had wonderful tips, and it was a great drive (be sure to visit the Island....he can give you the details!) We decided to have drinks and dinner at the Loch Lein when we got home...and were SO glad we did! The food was absolutely amazing. From the salad, to the main course, to the dessert. One of the best meals I had in Ireland, and we had a lot of good ones. We had breakfast both mornings, and the food was equally amazing and Annette was a gracious, wonderful host. There is also a younger gentleman who works there and he was extremely helpful as well. We also stayed in Cork, Dublin, and Co Mayo (at the Ashford Castle), and my husband and I both agree that Loch Lein was by far our best experience! We look forward to coming back to wonderful food, hospitality, and location. Thank you so much!
reviews.title: What a Gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment Paul greeted us at our car, we felt special. And that continued right through our stay. The hotel itself is understated elegance, from the quality of the room to the lounge area and dining room. And the views from our room overlooking the Loch were a joy to wake up to. Ask Paul for his salmon wrapped scrambled egg trick. We'd love to go back.
reviews.title: Elegance, welcoming,special

reviews.text: I stayed in Loch Lein for a weekend whilst hiking in Kerry. The view from my room was fantastic, looking out over the lake and the mountains beyond is a fabulous way to start any day. My room was very comfortable and the shower (very powerful) was glorious after a long day in the mountains. Both breakfast and dinner were delicious and of very good quality. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful, we had plenty of laughs and I can honestly say I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I would happily recommend this hotel to others and really hope I myself get the chance to return.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this excellent family-run hotel last weekend, as part of a Dublin group hill-walking in the Kerry mountains. The location was ideal, overlooking the lake and with easy access to the Macgilicuddy Reeks and Killarney's beauty spots. The hotel's facilities were excellent, well fitted out and serviced, with a big bedroom, friendly service and very good cuisine. We very much enjoyed our stay there, and hope to repeat our visit.
reviews.title: Patrick P

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The antithesis of hip, the Loch Lein House is a large modern suburban style house in a splendid position just outside Killarney. With sunlit meadows stretching down to the shimmering lake, framed by heather clad hill and a distant castle, the view from the guest rooms, dining room and small bar is its greatest attribute, that and the welcome hospitality of the hosts.
reviews.title: Comfort and hospitality overlooking the Loch

reviews.text: Rooms are very spacious, spotless and comfortably furnished, giving the hotel its homely atmosphere. Bathroom is large with separate shower and tub. This is a strictly ‘50 shades of grey with cerise and lime accents’-free zone. Food is excellent making good use of local produce, with large breakfast and sumptuous dinners, well prepared and presented but don’t expect anything too cutting edge and that suits just fine. The dining room is light and airy with great views and there is a small sitting room and adjoining bar area for house guests off the main entrance area with its Scarlett O’Hara stair.
reviews.title: Beautiful Loch Lein

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners are very welcoming, professional, friendly and efficient, taking a genuine interest in their guests and keen to help them when appropriate with their sightseeing plans.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at Loch Lein Country Hotel toward the end of April and it was breathtakingly beautiful. The hotel itself is gorgeous with wonderful attention to detail in the architecture of the building and in its furnishings. Fresh flowers everywhere and the facilities were extremely clean and well maintained. Our hosts, Annette and Paul, were extremely gracious and helpful. Paul spent a lot of time with us one morning setting up a Sheep Ranch visit. He also provided great advice on the best sites to see in the area. All in all it was a wonderful experience and we would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: More comfortable than your own home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights in this beautiful Country House.
reviews.title: Like being at home, with better food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment we were greeted at our car with welcoming wishes we knew our stay at this country house was going to be special. The hotel itself is understated elegance, from the quality of the room to the lounge area, and the dining room. The staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and took great care of all of our needs. From our room, we enjoyed a view of the Loch that was just breath-taking and a pure joy to wake up to. We also enjoyed dining here as the food was delicious and the breakfast were equally as good. I enjoyed the best omelet EVER! I must admit that the highlight of our stay was being blessed to view God's rainbow stretching across the Loch. It was a sight to behold! Loch Lein Country House is a must visit... you will not be disappointed!!!
reviews.title: Delightful Elegance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved staying at the Loch Lein Country House. It was beautiful, quiet, peaceful. We had a room with a Lake view. Paul and Annette were just the perfect hosts. They helped us figure out our itinerary every day. We will definite head back there again soon!
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently had the pleasure of staying at Loch Lein Country house in Killarney for 2 nights. We were immediately impressed with the warm welcome and the stunning view from our room.
reviews.title: Beauty and Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hosts couldn't do enough for us in terms of information and service. We particularly enjoyed the humour that accompanied the advice on places to visit and local history. This was one of our favourite places that we stayed in during our month away in the UK. We intend to make our way back for a longer stay to this exceptionally beautiful part of the world.
reviews.title: Best of Killarney

reviews.text: We stayed at Loch Lein Country House for two nights while exploring the ring of kerry. This bed and breakfast is one of the best we have stayed at. The service was exceptional, the rooms were great - super cozy and felt right at home. The breakfast each morning was exceptional, plenty of parking if you have rented a car. Both Anette and Kevin were so friendly and helpful! Highly Recommended if you are in the area!
reviews.title: Now that's what I call service

aka: Loch Lein Country House Hotel Killarney
